page.title: 01Gazette Of Area
page.content: The area we have studied is a tipical Welsh mining valley. The housing consists of council and private "estates"and older terraced housing. Education ranges from "nursery" through to further education and "special"education. It is a "black spot"for employment. The few factories in the area are small and employ a limited number. Therefore people travel outside for work. With high unemployment and people leaving the areas trade and recreational facilities have been affected.Many shops and cinemas have closed leaving derilect buildings. The redeeming features are the country park and the wide range of facilities for care of the elderly.
